p: Chronic HCV infection without cirrhosis is however associated with worse quality of life and symptoms (e.g. mood disorders and fatigue) than those who do not have this infection [ 3]. On large cohorts of patients, it is also widely demonstrated that chronic HCV infection is accompanied by extrahepatic manifestations including lymphoproliferative disorders (e.g. cryoglobulinaemic syndrome and non-Hodgkinâ€™s lymphoma), type II diabetes mellitus, insulin resistance, cardiovascular disease and kidney disease [ 4].
